# Number Pyramid

I found this interesting number pyramid pattern in an instagram reel and decided to implement it in Kotlin. The pyramid
consists of numbers arranged in a specific pattern across multiple rows for a given integer N.

```
1
7   2
12  8   3
16  13  9   4
19  17  14  10  5
22  20  18  15  11  6
```

Instead of doing a classic for-loop and printing whitespaces, I decided to use a List to calculate and store the numbers
in each row, then print them in reverse order.
